p: The study population consisted of 14,168 children diagnosed with EV infection and 14,168 children without EV infection. Table 1 shows the characteristics of the cohort and control group. The average age was 3.6 ( SD: 2.9) years old in the EV group and 3.8 ( SD: 3.0) years old in the control group. There was a significantly higher percentage of parents who were white-collar workers in the EV cohort group compared with the control group (cohort vs. control: 64.3 vs. 59.1%, p < 0.0001).
